title: West Community Associates: Leslie Goddard Program
hero_caption: Georgia O'Keeffe. Sky above Clouds IV, 1965. Restricted gift of the Paul and Gabriella Rosenbaum Foundation; gift of Georgia O'Keeffe, © The Art ...
description:
In this living-history performance, actress and historian Leslie Goddard, Ph.D, portrays a figure of significance in American culture.

Schedule of the Day:
4:30 Registration

5:00 Lecture

6:00 Dinner Buffet

Dinner Menu:
Pear and blue cheese salad tossed with white balsamic vinaigrette (blue cheese served on the side)

Entreé buffet

Apple blossom with vanilla ice cream and caramel sauce for dessert

Cash Bar

Speaker: Leslie Goddard

Registration Period: January 29, 2019—February 12, 2019

To contact the event planner, please reach out to Elizabeth Cerne at bethcerne@gmail.com or (630) 673-8111. To contact the assistant event planner, please reach out to RuthAnne Wilcox at racwilcox6669@yahoo.com, (630) 536-8821 or (630) 991-8660. You may also contact assistant event planner Celinda Risvold at cindyrisvold@uwalumni.com or (920) 266-6710.

This Community Associates event is exclusively for current Community Associates members. Membership will be verified at the door, and refunds cannot be issued for those without a valid membership. For Community Associates events that allow guests, nonmember guests must be registered by a Community Associates member.

If you are interested in becoming a member of Community Associates, please visit artic.edu/joinnow to join both the Art Institute of Chicago and the Community Associates group of your choice.
location: Stonebridge Country Club, 2705 Stonebridge Blvd., Aurora, IL 60540
buy_button_caption:
